full_summary:
===============

### Placing, Lifting, Removal, Maintaining and Servicing Buoys in the Province of Nova Scotia
===========================================================

#### Solicitation Information
---------------------------

*   **Title**: Placing, Lifting, Removal, Maintaining and Servicing Buoys in the Province of Nova Scotia
*   **Reference Number**: CB-462-68301644
*   **Public Posting Date**: May 8, 2024
*   **Tender Closing Date**: June 4, 2024 2:00 PM AST
*   **Expected Contract Start Date**: June 13, 2024
*   **Expected Contract End Date**: June 30, 2026

#### Background
-------------

The Canadian Coast Guard is soliciting services for placing, lifting, removing, maintaining, and servicing buoys around Nova Scotia. This solicitation aims to engage a contractor who can provide navigational aids throughout Canada's waterways.

The solicitation comprises three streams:

*   **Northern Nova Scotia (12 areas)**
*   **Eastern Nova Scotia (12 areas)**
*   **Southern Nova Scotia (9 areas)**

Bidders must identify which of the above streams they are bidding on and provide a comprehensive proposal for each selected stream.

#### Contract Details
----------------

This contract involves the delivery of services over a three-and-a-half-year duration, with an option to extend by up to two one-year periods.

**Key Contract Dates**

*   **Contract Award Date**: Anticipated June 21, 2024
*   **Contract End Date**: Anticipated June 30, 2026

#### Trade Agreements
-----------------

This solicitation complies with the following government of Canada trade agreements:

*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
*   Canada-United Kingdom Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
*   Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic Trade Agreement (CETA)
*   Canada-China Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
*   Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
*   Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
*   World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
